Hero.title: Mheen… A Memory That Lives On
Hero.intro: Mheen, a town in eastern Homs countryside, stands as a symbol of resilience and dignity. This independent archive documents its history, honors its martyrs, and preserves the stories of its people.
Hero.eyebrow: Welcome to the heart of the Syrian Badia
Hero.subtitle: Ancient history, a green oasis, and a memory that never dies. Discover the story of a town that defied geography.

Home.pillar1Desc: Documenting martyrs, detainees, and the sacrifices of the town's people.
Home.pillar2Desc: From desert tents to Aramaic roots — a journey into the depths of history.
Home.pillar3Desc: Voices, stories, and initiatives of Mheen's people around the world.
Home.pillar4Desc: Be part of documenting this journey.
Home.oasisTitle: The Pearl of the Syrian Badia
Home.oasisText: Mheen sits in the heart of the Syrian Badia at 900 meters above sea level, only 20 km from the M5 international highway. Its living springs and groundwater connection gave it the Aramaic name 'Living Waters' — Mia chi.
Home.latestSubtitle: Personal stories and testimonies from the people of Mheen

about.etymArabicDesc: Means beauty, tenderness, and the high status of an oasis amid the desert.

about.timelineTitle: Mheen at the Heart of Transformations (2011–2026)
about.tl1Desc: The battle of 'Mheen Depots' erupted (Syria's second-largest arsenal) between opposition factions and regime forces.
about.tl2Desc: ISIS seized control in November, followed by intensive Russian airstrikes and massive destruction that led to the group's withdrawal.
about.tl3Desc: Thousands of residents fled to the desolate 'Rukban' border camp, where dozens of families slept on sand with no services or care.
about.tl4Desc: The fall of the Assad regime and opposition forces entering Homs, marking a new era for Mheen under transitional authority.
about.tl5Desc: Facing an unprecedented drought (worst in 36 years), and challenges of landmine contamination and war remnants hindering agriculture.

mheenStory.heroSub: The Oasis of the Badia, the Node of History
mheenStory.topoDesc: Situated in the heart of the Syrian Badia at 900 m elevation, only 20 km from Syria's vital artery — the M5 international highway.
mheenStory.etymArabicDesc: Means beauty, tenderness, and the high status of an oasis amid the desert.
mheenStory.etymAramaicDesc: Derived from 'Living Waters' (Mia chi), linked to its springs and groundwater.
mheenStory.etymPersianDesc: Matches the word 'Mah' meaning 'Moon-like', symbolizing radiance.
mheenStory.mil1Desc: The Mheen military depots — one of the Syrian Army's largest weapon and ammo stockpiles, turning the town into a strategic target for all parties.
mheenStory.mil2Desc: A fortified military complex of dozens of buildings, tunnels, and fortifications that transformed the area into an actual military fortress.
mheenStory.mil3Desc: Mheen witnessed fierce battles in 2013 for control of the depots, then ISIS invasion in 2015 followed by devastating Russian airstrikes.
mheenStory.darkHeadline: From the Oasis to the Sands…
mheenStory.darkSub: The Displacement Journey to Rukban Camp
mheenStory.darkQuote: Dozens of families slept on sand under the open sky with no shelter materials whatsoever.
mheenStory.darkWarning: Today: The worst drought in 36 years, and deadly contamination from war remnants threatening the oasis's revival.
mheenStory.travQuote: He passed by two small neighboring towns, 'Mheen' and 'Hawarin', between them lies water enough for both, and in each about 20 houses; the dress of their people is that of the desert folk and their dialect is the dialect of the desert.
mheenStory.travModern: From 20 mud-brick houses to an agricultural and commercial hub of 17,000 residents before the revolution, retaining its tribal roots.
mheenStory.fabDesc: Mheen has been characterized by an independent Sunni tribal structure, yet established a pragmatic model of coexistence throughout history.
mheenStory.fab1Desc: A historic tribal agricultural hub in the heart of the Badia.
mheenStory.fab2Desc: A neighboring Christian town historically linked to Mheen through trade and agriculture.
mheenStory.fab3Desc: An ancient historical village sharing deep roots with Mheen.
mheenStory.rec1Desc: Abdelkader al-Jazairi school alone accommodated 600 students with suffocating classroom density.
mheenStory.rec2Desc: Only 3 sub-stations to serve all returning residents.
mheenStory.rec3Desc: Absence of medical staff, complete reliance on mobile clinics.
mheenStory.rec4Desc: A lone agricultural tractor for managing and transporting waste weekly.
mheenStory.costTitle: The Human Cost & Path to Justice
mheenStory.cost1Desc: An unprecedented global decline since WWII in psychological and physical well-being levels, with permanent injuries without medical care.
mheenStory.cost2Desc: Establishment of the Transitional Justice Committee and the National Commission for the Missing to uncover the fate of Mheen's sons and hold perpetrators accountable.

aboutProject.title: About the Project
aboutProject.subtitle: An independent documentary initiative preserving the memory of Mheen for future generations
aboutProject.visionText: Mheen Memory Archive is an independent, non-profit documentary initiative born out of the need to preserve the town's history and honor the sacrifices of its people. Our goal is to build a secure and reliable digital reference that can be passed down through generations, ensuring that no story or sacrifice is ever forgotten.
aboutProject.creatorRole: Tech content creator, entrepreneur, and a son of Mheen
aboutProject.creatorBio: Driven by a sense of duty toward my hometown Mheen, I leveraged my expertise in technology to create this archive. As a developer and entrepreneur passionate about cutting-edge technologies, I took it upon myself to build this platform as a voice for every son and daughter of Mheen, and a safe space to preserve our national memory.
aboutProject.techSubtitle: Silicon Valley-grade engineering for speed, security, and durability
aboutProject.tech1Desc: Engineered with Next.js 15 and Cloudflare Edge networks to ensure blazing-fast access from anywhere in the world.
aboutProject.tech2Desc: Globally distributed, encrypted database (D1) to protect the data and details of martyrs and stories from any loss or breach.
aboutProject.tech3Desc: Using R2 servers to permanently and reliably store documents and photos for future generations.

community.title: Community & Identity
community.subtitle: The scent of the land, the authenticity of the Badia, and the tales of the ancestors that shaped Mheen's soul.
community.peopleTitle: The People of Mheen: Bedouin Generosity and Rural Authenticity
community.peopleText: The people of Mheen are known for their kindness and hospitality. In them, the authenticity of the Syrian Badia appears with its chivalry and simplicity, blended with a deep bond to land and agriculture. Families have preserved cohesive tribal and rural traditions; open guest gatherings, the bitter Arabic coffee cup, and collective support in harvest seasons and celebrations are not merely daily habits, but a deeply rooted identity passed down generation after generation, making the town one large family united by familiarity and affection.
community.harvest1Text: The people of Mheen benefited from the springs of the surrounding hills, turning the town into a green oasis known for olive, fig, apricot, and grape cultivation. Harvest seasons are not just work; they are social rituals that gather families and are passed down from one generation to the next.
community.harvest2Text: Cooperation among neighbors in irrigation, pruning, and picking shaped a cohesive daily culture where livelihood is tied to collective spirit. Seasons were opportunities for sharing expertise and teaching younger generations the values of patience and belonging.
community.daily1Body: Preserving authentic Bedouin traditions, open gatherings, and bitter Arabic coffee as a lasting symbol of welcome.
community.daily2Body: A modest trading center that gathers agricultural produce and serves as a daily meeting point for townspeople.
community.daily3Title: Hands of the Diaspora: Mheen in the Gulf
community.daily3Body: Mheen expatriates played a vital role in the town's development and reconstruction, blending the authenticity of the past with urban progress they brought back.
community.trainTitle: Mheen Train Station: The Artery of Connection
community.trainText: The railway passing through Mheen played a major role in connecting crops to markets, and stood witness to residents' journeys and travel stories between Homs and Damascus.
community.gallerySubtitle: Images carrying the fragrance of the past, documenting daily life, kind faces, and social occasions.
